meanings.definition: Not adhering or sticking to something.
meanings.sent1: The noncling paper easily floated away in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The noncling feathers fell gently to the ground.
meanings.sent3: The noncling sticker kept falling off the wall, much to the frustration of the owner.
meanings.sent4: Her noncling personality made her stand out in a crowd of conformists.
meanings.sent5: The noncling leaves danced in the wind, refusing to be held down.

meanings.definition: To not hold onto or grasp tightly.
meanings.sent1: She tried to noncling to the slippery rope but kept slipping.
meanings.sent2: The child learned to noncling to the monkey bars without fear.
meanings.sent3: He had to noncling to the idea that not everything could be controlled.
meanings.sent4: The memories noncling in his mind slipped away like sand through his fingers.
meanings.sent5: She had to noncling to the railing to prevent herself from falling down the stairs.

meanings.definition: To not remain attached or connected.
meanings.sent1: The old paint started to noncling from the walls, revealing the original color.
meanings.sent2: The vine began to noncling from the trellis as the wind picked up.
meanings.sent3: The friendship slowly started to noncling as they drifted apart.
meanings.sent4: The astronaut felt like he was noncling to Earth as he gazed at the vastness of space.
meanings.sent5: The sandcastle started to noncling together as the tide came in.
